div.div: Commented on #1211 Unable to use WhisperX with Blackwell GPU (sm_120)
#1182 is expected to function on Blackwell (RTX 50XX), but I have no hardware to test it. If you could share the results (or any error messages) I would be grateful.
Closed #34 重新設計「預印論文影響力」section：移除學科分布和趨勢分析，改為即時顯示 viXra 下載次數

feat(index): rebrand to Kuo Tso Chen, refresh metadata
- Rebrand the site from the research center to Kuo Tso Chen by updating author/publisher details, Twitter handles, OG and structured data images, dates, copyright, and footer text, and switching all contact emails to gtchen0@gmail.com with mailto actions on call-to-action buttons. Remove the contact info section, hide the newsletter signup pending implementation, and refresh metadata across schema and social tags.
Signed-off-by: Jim Chen <Jim@ChenJ.im>

refactor: simplify content sections and remove uncertain timelines
- Simplify global warming solution section to key message only - Change economic analysis section to 'calculating' status - Replace specific years (2025-2035) with '20??' in roadmap timeline - Remove academic conference countdown and paper review progress cards - Maintain clean UI layout with centered remaining content
These changes avoid presenting unverified data while keeping the core message clear and professional.
Signed-off-by: Jim Chen <Jim@ChenJ.im>

feat: redesign international collaboration section UI
- Replace simple text layout with modern gradient-enhanced design - Add animated background elements with pulsing gradient orbs - Implement glassmorphism effect with backdrop blur and rounded corners - Enhance typography with gradient text effects and visual separators - Redesign contact CTA with prominent email button and hover animations - Add three collaboration type cards (academic, energy, R&D institutions) - Improve visual hierarchy with better spacing and modern card layouts - Include SVG icons for enhanced visual communication - Apply responsive design with mobile-first approach - Integrate smooth transitions and transform effects for better UX
The new design provides a more engaging and professional appearance while maintaining accessibility and usability standards.
Signed-off-by: Jim Chen <Jim@ChenJ.im>

chore: remove academic responses analysis section
- Remove the academic responses analysis section, including its positive, constructive questions, and challenges subsections with counts, streamlining the page before the publication challenges section.
Signed-off-by: Jim Chen <Jim@ChenJ.im>

chore: 重新設計「預印論文影響力」section：移除學科分布和趨勢分析
This PR addresses CORS blocking issues with viXra by replacing the dynamic real-time download counter with a static hardcoded display showing 194 downloads.
## Problem The original implementation attempted to fetch real-time download data from `https://vixra.org/abs/2412.0035` but encountered CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) restrictions that prevented the fetch from succeeding in browsers.
## Solution Replaced the dynamic fetching system with a static implementation:
- **Moved HTML content** from `paper-downloads.js` directly into `index.html` - **Hardcoded download number** as **194** instead of real-time fetching - **Removed dynamic functionality** including `paper-downloads.js` file and associated script loading - **Preserved visual design** by migrating necessary CSS styles to `assets/css/styles.css`
## Technical Changes
**Removed Dynamic Components:** - Entire `PaperDownloads` class with fetch logic, retry mechanisms, and caching - Error handling for network failures and parsing errors - Auto-refresh timers and manual refresh functionality - localStorage caching system
**Static Implementation:** - Clean HTML structure directly embedded in `index.html` - Disabled refresh button with appropriate visual styling - Static timestamp showing "最後更新：2024年12月" - Maintained all original visual styling and responsive design
**CSS Migration:** - Counter pulse animations (`@keyframes counterPulse`) - Green gradient text styling (`.count-number`) - Loading state animations moved from JavaScript to CSS
## Visual Result
The section maintains identical visual appearance while displaying the static download count:
![Static Paper Impact Section](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e4c3004b-8b46-41fd-a441-b152ddd6df8f)
**File Impact:** -
**Removed:** `assets/js/paper-downloads.js` (496 lines of dynamic fetching code) -
**Modified:** `index.html` (+23 lines of static HTML content) -
**Modified:** `assets/css/styles.css` (+26 lines of migrated styles)
This change resolves the CORS restriction while maintaining the user experience and visual consistency of the download counter display.

chore: improve Chinese wording and remove refresh button
- Update Chinese interface wording for download statistics, remove the disabled refresh button, and update the "last updated" date to August 2025.
Signed-off-by: Jim Chen <Jim@ChenJ.im>

Replace dynamic viXra fetch with hardcoded download count of 194
- Move dynamic HTML from paper-downloads.js to index.html - Hardcode download number as 194 instead of dynamic fetching - Remove paper-downloads.js file and script tag - Add necessary CSS styles to styles.css - Keep visual design consistent while removing CORS-dependent functionality
Addresses CORS blocking issues with viXra by using static content instead of dynamic fetching.
Co-authored-by: jim60105 <16995691+jim60105@users.noreply.github.com>

Fix Utils.DOM class methods to handle one class at a time
Co-authored-by: jim60105 <16995691+jim60105@users.noreply.github.com>

Implement live viXra download counter with comprehensive UI and error handling
Co-authored-by: jim60105 <16995691+jim60105@users.noreply.github.com>
